value.name: Falkirk Council agree to close Bo'ness Recreation Centre within three months
value.description: Bo’ness Recreation Centre will close within three months despite a determined campaign by residents hoping to save it.

value.name: The House of Sturgeon has turned into a mound of dust
value.description: Record Political Editor Paul Hutcheon says her confident handling of covid was part of her legacy, but this has now gone.

value.name: Sturgeon wasn’t wrong to delete WhatsApp messages as all ‘appropriate info handed over’, says SNP’s Ian Blackford
value.description: We spoke to the former leader of the Scottish National Party in Westminster, Ian Blackford. We asked him whether Nicola Sturgeon was wrong to say that all government messages would be available to the inquiry.

value.name: Driver who indecently assaulted and threatened woman loses licence
value.description: A Glasgow private hire car driver who indecently assaulted a woman and threatened to abduct her while working has lost his licence. Mazin Mohamed seized the passenger by the breast during the terrifying ordeal in a city street in April 2022.

value.name: Nicola Sturgeon denies Covid decisions were political
value.description: Nicola Sturgeon has denied that some of her decisions during the Covid pandemic were motivated by furthering the cause of Scottish independence. The former first minister also rejected claims she presided over a culture of secrecy despite admitting she deleted all her WhatsApps during the pandemic.

value.name: Former FM Nicola Sturgeon returns to centre stage at Covid Inquiry
value.description: The marathon evidence session was a reminder of her key role during one of the bleakest periods in living memory.

value.name: It is clear indy was on the backburner during the pandemic period
value.description: IT is quite evident that the Scottish Parliament and Scottish Government operate under very different parameters, rules and regulations to those

value.name: Can the SNP ever recover from the fall of Nicola Sturgeon?
value.description: Nicola Sturgeon became vital to the SNP and has dominated Scottish politics for more than a decade, writes Sean O’Grady

value.name: Nicola Sturgeon accused of ‘crocodile tears’ at Covid-19 inquiry
value.description: But critics, including the Covid bereaved families, hit out at the former Scottish National Party (SNP) leader, who resigned in a shock move last year ahead of further police investigation into party finances, accusing her of faking her emotions.

value.name: Nicola Sturgeon denies secrecy and political motives during emotional evidence to UK Covid Inquiry
value.description: Nicola Sturgeon denied adopting a secretive approach during the pandemic and insisted she did not seek to use the crisis to her political advantage as she occasionally fought back tears while giving evidence to the UK Covid Inquiry.

value.name: UK Covid Inquiry: Nicola Sturgeon misses chance to allay public concerns over why she deleted her WhatsApp messages – Euan McColm
value.description: Former First Minister Nicola Sturgeon made a failed attempt to advance a semantic argument that her WhatsApp messages were ‘not retained’ rather than ‘deleted’

value.name: Nicola Sturgeon booed and called ‘scum’ as she leaves covid inquiry after tearful apology to bereaved families
value.description: NICOLA Sturgeon was booed as she left the UK Covid Inquiry. The former First Minister was quizzed on her Government’s handling of the pandemic in Scotland. The ex-SNP boss became emotional

value.name: ‘Sleekit’ Sturgeon deleted messages on an industrial scale, says Ross
value.description: Scottish Conservative leader Douglas Ross used a debate at Holyrood to attack the former Scottish first minister, branding her a ‘liar’ and a ‘fraud’.

value.name: American XL bully ban dates confirmed for Scotland
value.description: XL bully dogs will be subject to new controls in Scotland New restrictions on XL bully dogs are being introduced in Scotland from 23 February. It will be legal to own one of the dogs but they must be muzzled and on a lead in public from that date.

value.name: QUENTIN LETTS: The real reason knuckle-duster Nicola Sturgeon sprang a leak and started blubbing... because she knows she's finished
value.description: We had a Stan Laurel moment at the Covid inquiry when Nicola Sturgeon started blubbing. She didn't quite remove her bowler hat and start scratching her head but it was a close-run thing.

value.name: Keir Starmer clashes with Rishi Sunak over Iceland worker's mortgage
value.description: Keir Starmer raises one man's case, as Rishi Sunak says he is helping people whose fixed-rate mortgage deals are ending.

value.name: Wedding venue owned by West Lothian Council loses £77,000 in last year
value.description: A West Lothian wedding venue run by the council is set to make a loss of £77,000 this year. A council officer could provide no answers when a local member raised the deficit and questions on plans to recoup losses at Linlithgow’s Burgh Halls.

value.name: Covid Inquiry: Sturgeon denies 'burning desire' for independence influenced decisions
value.description: Nicola Sturgeon has denied that her “burning desire” to achieve Scottish independence played any role in her pandemic decision making. Jamie Dawson KC, counsel for the inquiry
